column4: matt from wordpress here, could anyone point me in the direction of getting ubuntu to recognize more than 4 GB of memory?
hi, great job on wordpress. does your motherboard support it?
thanks! we had freebsd on the box before and that recognized all 8gb, if that answers your question
is it a 32 bit or 64 bit?
64-bit xeons
and are you running a smp kernel, uname -a
uname -a returns: Linux db2.wordpress.com 2.6.12-9-386 #1 Tue Oct 4 18:44:03 BST 2005 i686 GNU/Linux
i think it's not seeing only 4GB of memory as you are running a 32 bit kernel. try getting a 64 bit kernel, and you should be fine
I'll try that, thank you very much!
np :)
if you want an invite to wordpress.com or anything, let me know
already have one, http://robotgeek.wordpress.com
thanks to carthik -> nalioth :)
awesome. :)
nope, this is on a remote server, all I have is shell
let me know if it works :)
are u using a live cd, if so try the AMD-64 cd. (i belive it would work if your xeon's have EM64T extension). I am not sure what it means, i've never used a 64bit os :)
hmm, so are u doing a netinstall?
someone else installed it, I'm just trying to make it work now
oh okay, then you might have to do a kernel recompile. i think
or install the amd-64 version of ubuntu
